description: Triangle of generalized sum of divisors function, read by rows.
references: P. A. MacMahon, Divisors of numbers and their continuations in the theory of partitions, Proc. London Math. Soc., (2) 19 (1919), 75-113; Coll. Papers II, pp. 303-341.
formula: T(n, k) = sum of s_1*s_2*...*s_k where s_1, s_2, ..., s_k are such that s_1*(2*m_1-1) + s_2*(2*m_2-1) + ... + s_k*(2*m_k-1) = n and the sum is over all such k-partitions of n.G.f. for k-th diagonal (the k-th row of the sideways triangle shown in the example): Sum_{ m_1 < m_2 < ... < m_k} q^(2*m_1+2*m_2+...+2*m_k-k)/((1-q^{2*m_1-1})*(1-q^{2*m_2-1})*...*(1-q^{2*m_k-1}))^2 = Sum_n T(n, k)*q^n.
example: Triangle turned on its side begins:  1  2  4  4  6  8  8  8 13 12 12 ...           1  2  4  8 14 18 28 40 ...                          1  2  4 ...For example, T(6,1) = 8, T(6,2) = 4.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 19 2001
